580 std::optional LoopPredication::widenICmpRangeCheckIncrementingLoop( 580 std::optional LoopPredication::widenICmpRangeCheckIncrementingLoop(
581 LoopICmp LatchCheck, LoopICmp RangeCheck, SCEVExpander &Expander, 581 LoopICmp LatchCheck, LoopICmp RangeCheck, SCEVExpander &Expander,
582 Instruction *Guard) { 582 Instruction *Guard) {
583 auto *Ty = RangeCheck.IV->getType(); 583 auto *Ty = RangeCheck.IV->getType();
584 // Generate the widened condition for the forward loop: 584 // Generate the widened condition for the forward loop:
585 // guardStart u< guardLimit && 585 // guardStart u< guardLimit &&
586 // latchLimit guardLimit - 1 - guardStart + latchStart 586 // latchLimit guardLimit - 1 - guardStart + latchStart
587 // where depends on the latch condition predicate. See the file 587 // where depends on the latch condition predicate. See the file
588 // header comment for the reasoning. 588 // header comment for the reasoning.
589 // guardLimit - guardStart + latchStart - 1 589 // guardLimit - guardStart + latchStart - 1
590 const SCEV *GuardStart = RangeCheck.IV->getStart(); 590 const SCEV *GuardStart = RangeCheck.IV->getStart();
591 const SCEV *GuardLimit = RangeCheck.Limit; 591 const SCEV *GuardLimit = RangeCheck.Limit;
592 const SCEV *LatchStart = LatchCheck.IV->getStart(); 592 const SCEV *LatchStart = LatchCheck.IV->getStart();
593 const SCEV *LatchLimit = LatchCheck.Limit; 593 const SCEV *LatchLimit = LatchCheck.Limit;
594 // Subtlety: We need all the values to be *invariant* across all iterations, 594 // Subtlety: We need all the values to be *invariant* across all iterations,
595 // but we only need to check expansion safety for those which *aren't* 595 // but we only need to check expansion safety for those which *aren't*
596 // already guaranteed to dominate the guard. 596 // already guaranteed to dominate the guard.
597 if (!isLoopInvariantValue(GuardStart) || 597 if (!isLoopInvariantValue(GuardStart) ||
598 !isLoopInvariantValue(GuardLimit) || 598 !isLoopInvariantValue(GuardLimit) ||
599 !isLoopInvariantValue(LatchStart) || 599 !isLoopInvariantValue(LatchStart) ||
600 !isLoopInvariantValue(LatchLimit)) { 600 !isLoopInvariantValue(LatchLimit)) {
601 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Can't expand limit check!\n"); 601 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Can't expand limit check!\n");
602 return std::nullopt; 602 return std::nullopt;
603 } 603 }
604 if (!Expander.isSafeToExpandAt(LatchStart, Guard) || 604 if (!Expander.isSafeToExpandAt(LatchStart, Guard) ||
605 !Expander.isSafeToExpandAt(LatchLimit, Guard)) { 605 !Expander.isSafeToExpandAt(LatchLimit, Guard)) {
606 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Can't expand limit check!\n"); 606 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Can't expand limit check!\n");
607 return std::nullopt; 607 return std::nullopt;
608 } 608 }
609 609
610 // guardLimit - guardStart + latchStart - 1 610 // guardLimit - guardStart + latchStart - 1
611 const SCEV *RHS = 611 const SCEV *RHS =
612 SE->getAddExpr(SE->getMinusSCEV(GuardLimit, GuardStart), 612 SE->getAddExpr(SE->getMinusSCEV(GuardLimit, GuardStart),
613 SE->getMinusSCEV(LatchStart, SE->getOne(Ty))); 613 SE->getMinusSCEV(LatchStart, SE->getOne(Ty)));
614 auto LimitCheckPred = 614 auto LimitCheckPred =
615 ICmpInst::getFlippedStrictnessPredicate(LatchCheck.Pred); 615 ICmpInst::getFlippedStrictnessPredicate(LatchCheck.Pred);
616 616
617 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "LHS: " << *LatchLimit << "\n"); 617 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "LHS: " << *LatchLimit << "\n");
618 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "RHS: " << *RHS << "\n"); 618 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "RHS: " << *RHS << "\n");
619 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Pred: " << LimitCheckPred << "\n"); 619 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Pred: " << LimitCheckPred << "\n");
620 620
621 auto *LimitCheck = 621 auto *LimitCheck =
622 expandCheck(Expander, Guard, LimitCheckPred, LatchLimit, RHS); 622 expandCheck(Expander, Guard, LimitCheckPred, LatchLimit, RHS);
623 auto *FirstIterationCheck = expandCheck(Expander, Guard, RangeCheck.Pred, 623 auto *FirstIterationCheck = expandCheck(Expander, Guard, RangeCheck.Pred,
624 GuardStart, GuardLimit); 624 GuardStart, GuardLimit);
625 IRBuilder<> Builder(findInsertPt(Guard, {FirstIterationCheck, LimitCheck})); 625 IRBuilder<> Builder(findInsertPt(Guard, {FirstIterationCheck, LimitCheck}));
626 return Builder.CreateFreeze( 626 return Builder.CreateFreeze(
627 Builder.CreateAnd(FirstIterationCheck, LimitCheck)); 627 Builder.CreateAnd(FirstIterationCheck, LimitCheck));
628 } 628 }

678 678
679 static void normalizePredicate(ScalarEvolution *SE, Loop *L, 679 static void normalizePredicate(ScalarEvolution *SE, Loop *L,
680 LoopICmp& RC) { 680 LoopICmp& RC) {
681 // LFTR canonicalizes checks to the ICMP_NE/EQ form; normalize back to the 681 // LFTR canonicalizes checks to the ICMP_NE/EQ form; normalize back to the
682 // ULT/UGE form for ease of handling by our caller. 682 // ULT/UGE form for ease of handling by our caller.
683 if (ICmpInst::isEquality(RC.Pred) && 683 if (ICmpInst::isEquality(RC.Pred) &&
684 RC.IV->getStepRecurrence(*SE)->isOne() && 684 RC.IV->getStepRecurrence(*SE)->isOne() &&
685 SE->isKnownPredicate(ICmpInst::ICMP_ULE, RC.IV->getStart(), RC.Limit)) 685 SE->isKnownPredicate(ICmpInst::ICMP_ULE, RC.IV->getStart(), RC.Limit))
686 RC.Pred = RC.Pred == ICmpInst::ICMP_NE ? 686 RC.Pred = RC.Pred == ICmpInst::ICMP_NE ?
687 ICmpInst::ICMP_ULT : ICmpInst::ICMP_UGE; 687 ICmpInst::ICMP_ULT : ICmpInst::ICMP_UGE;
688 } 688 }
689 689
690 /// If ICI can be widened to a loop invariant condition emits the loop 690 /// If ICI can be widened to a loop invariant condition emits the loop
691 /// invariant condition in the loop preheader and return it, otherwise 691 /// invariant condition in the loop preheader and return it, otherwise
692 /// returns std::nullopt. 692 /// returns std::nullopt.
693 std::optional 693 std::optional
694 LoopPredication::widenICmpRangeCheck(ICmpInst *ICI, SCEVExpander &Expander, 694 LoopPredication::widenICmpRangeCheck(ICmpInst *ICI, SCEVExpander &Expander,
695 Instruction *Guard) { 695 Instruction *Guard) {
696 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Analyzing ICmpInst condition:\n"); 696 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Analyzing ICmpInst condition:\n");
697 LLVM_DEBUG(ICI->dump()); 697 LLVM_DEBUG(ICI->dump());
698 698
699 // parseLoopStructure guarantees that the latch condition is: 699 // parseLoopStructure guarantees that the latch condition is:
700 // ++i latchLimit, where is u<, u<=, s<, or s<=. 700 // ++i latchLimit, where is u<, u<=, s<, or s<=.
701 // We are looking for the range checks of the form: 701 // We are looking for the range checks of the form:
702 // i u< guardLimit 702 // i u< guardLimit
703 auto RangeCheck = parseLoopICmp(ICI); 703 auto RangeCheck = parseLoopICmp(ICI);
704 if (!RangeCheck) { 704 if (!RangeCheck) {
705 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Failed to parse the loop latch condition!\n"); 705 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Failed to parse the loop latch condition!\n");
706 return std::nullopt; 706 return std::nullopt;
707 } 707 }
708 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Guard check:\n"); 708 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Guard check:\n");
709 LLVM_DEBUG(RangeCheck->dump()); 709 LLVM_DEBUG(RangeCheck->dump());
710 if (RangeCheck->Pred != ICmpInst::ICMP_ULT) { 710 if (RangeCheck->Pred != ICmpInst::ICMP_ULT) {
711 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Unsupported range check predicate(" 711 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Unsupported range check predicate("
712 << RangeCheck->Pred << ")!\n"); 712 << RangeCheck->Pred << ")!\n");
713 return std::nullopt; 713 return std::nullopt;
714 } 714 }
715 auto *RangeCheckIV = RangeCheck->IV; 715 auto *RangeCheckIV = RangeCheck->IV;
716 if (!RangeCheckIV->isAffine()) { 716 if (!RangeCheckIV->isAffine()) {
717 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Range check IV is not affine!\n"); 717 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Range check IV is not affine!\n");
718 return std::nullopt; 718 return std::nullopt;
719 } 719 }
720 auto *Step = RangeCheckIV->getStepRecurrence(*SE); 720 auto *Step = RangeCheckIV->getStepRecurrence(*SE);
721 // We cannot just compare with latch IV step because the latch and range IVs 721 // We cannot just compare with latch IV step because the latch and range IVs
722 // may have different types. 722 // may have different types.
723 if (!isSupportedStep(Step)) { 723 if (!isSupportedStep(Step)) {
724 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Range check and latch have IVs different steps!\n"); 724 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Range check and latch have IVs different steps!\n");
725 return std::nullopt; 725 return std::nullopt;
726 } 726 }
727 auto *Ty = RangeCheckIV->getType(); 727 auto *Ty = RangeCheckIV->getType();
728 auto CurrLatchCheckOpt = generateLoopLatchCheck(*DL, *SE, LatchCheck, Ty); 728 auto CurrLatchCheckOpt = generateLoopLatchCheck(*DL, *SE, LatchCheck, Ty);
729 if (!CurrLatchCheckOpt) { 729 if (!CurrLatchCheckOpt) {
730 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Failed to generate a loop latch check " 730 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Failed to generate a loop latch check "
731 "corresponding to range type: " 731 "corresponding to range type: "
732 << *Ty << "\n"); 732 << *Ty << "\n");
733 return std::nullopt; 733 return std::nullopt;
734 } 734 }
735 735
736 LoopICmp CurrLatchCheck = *CurrLatchCheckOpt; 736 LoopICmp CurrLatchCheck = *CurrLatchCheckOpt;
737 // At this point, the range and latch step should have the same type, but need 737 // At this point, the range and latch step should have the same type, but need
738 // not have the same value (we support both 1 and -1 steps). 738 // not have the same value (we support both 1 and -1 steps).
739 assert(Step->getType() == 739 assert(Step->getType() ==
740 CurrLatchCheck.IV->getStepRecurrence(*SE)->getType() && 740 CurrLatchCheck.IV->getStepRecurrence(*SE)->getType() &&
741 "Range and latch steps should be of same type!"); 741 "Range and latch steps should be of same type!");
742 if (Step != CurrLatchCheck.IV->getStepRecurrence(*SE)) { 742 if (Step != CurrLatchCheck.IV->getStepRecurrence(*SE)) {
743 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Range and latch have different step values!\n"); 743 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Range and latch have different step values!\n");
744 return std::nullopt; 744 return std::nullopt;
745 } 745 }
746 746
747 if (Step->isOne()) 747 if (Step->isOne())
748 return widenICmpRangeCheckIncrementingLoop(CurrLatchCheck, *RangeCheck, 748 return widenICmpRangeCheckIncrementingLoop(CurrLatchCheck, *RangeCheck,
749 Expander, Guard); 749 Expander, Guard);
750 else { 750 else {
751 assert(Step->isAllOnesValue() && "Step should be -1!"); 751 assert(Step->isAllOnesValue() && "Step should be -1!");
752 return widenICmpRangeCheckDecrementingLoop(CurrLatchCheck, *RangeCheck, 752 return widenICmpRangeCheckDecrementingLoop(CurrLatchCheck, *RangeCheck,
753 Expander, Guard); 753 Expander, Guard);
754 } 754 }
755 } 755 }
756 756
757 unsigned LoopPredication::collectChecks(SmallVectorImpl &Checks, 757 unsigned LoopPredication::collectChecks(SmallVectorImpl &Checks,
758 Value *Condition, 758 Value *Condition,
759 SCEVExpander &Expander, 759 SCEVExpander &Expander,
760 Instruction *Guard) { 760 Instruction *Guard) {
761 unsigned NumWidened = 0; 761 unsigned NumWidened = 0;
762 // The guard condition is expected to be in form of: 762 // The guard condition is expected to be in form of:
763 // cond1 && cond2 && cond3 ... 763 // cond1 && cond2 && cond3 ...
764 // Iterate over subconditions looking for icmp conditions which can be 764 // Iterate over subconditions looking for icmp conditions which can be
765 // widened across loop iterations. Widening these conditions remember the 765 // widened across loop iterations. Widening these conditions remember the
766 // resulting list of subconditions in Checks vector. 766 // resulting list of subconditions in Checks vector.
767 SmallVector Worklist(1, Condition); 767 SmallVector Worklist(1, Condition);
768 SmallPtrSet Visited; 768 SmallPtrSet Visited;
769 Visited.insert(Condition); 769 Visited.insert(Condition);
770 Value *WideableCond = nullptr; 770 Value *WideableCond = nullptr;
771 do { 771 do {
772 Value *Condition = Worklist.pop_back_val(); 772 Value *Condition = Worklist.pop_back_val();
773 Value *LHS, *RHS; 773 Value *LHS, *RHS;
774 using namespace llvm::PatternMatch; 774 using namespace llvm::PatternMatch;
775 if (match(Condition, m_And(m_Value(LHS), m_Value(RHS)))) { 775 if (match(Condition, m_And(m_Value(LHS), m_Value(RHS)))) {
776 if (Visited.insert(LHS).second) 776 if (Visited.insert(LHS).second)
777 Worklist.push_back(LHS); 777 Worklist.push_back(LHS);
778 if (Visited.insert(RHS).second) 778 if (Visited.insert(RHS).second)
779 Worklist.push_back(RHS); 779 Worklist.push_back(RHS);
780 continue; 780 continue;
781 } 781 }
782 782
783 if (match(Condition, 783 if (match(Condition,
784 m_Intrinsic())) { 784 m_Intrinsic())) {
785 // Pick any, we don't care which 785 // Pick any, we don't care which
786 WideableCond = Condition; 786 WideableCond = Condition;
787 continue; 787 continue;
788 } 788 }
789 789
790 if (ICmpInst *ICI = dyn_cast(Condition)) { 790 if (ICmpInst *ICI = dyn_cast(Condition)) {
791 if (auto NewRangeCheck = widenICmpRangeCheck(ICI, Expander, 791 if (auto NewRangeCheck = widenICmpRangeCheck(ICI, Expander,
792 Guard)) { 792 Guard)) {
793 Checks.push_back(*NewRangeCheck); 793 Checks.push_back(*NewRangeCheck);
794 NumWidened++; 794 NumWidened++;

796 } 796 }
797 } 797 }
798 798
799 // Save the condition as is if we can't widen it 799 // Save the condition as is if we can't widen it
800 Checks.push_back(Condition); 800 Checks.push_back(Condition);
801 } while (!Worklist.empty()); 801 } while (!Worklist.empty());
802 // At the moment, our matching logic for wideable conditions implicitly 802 // At the moment, our matching logic for wideable conditions implicitly
803 // assumes we preserve the form: (br (and Cond, WC())). FIXME 803 // assumes we preserve the form: (br (and Cond, WC())). FIXME
804 // Note that if there were multiple calls to wideable condition in the 804 // Note that if there were multiple calls to wideable condition in the
805 // traversal, we only need to keep one, and which one is arbitrary. 805 // traversal, we only need to keep one, and which one is arbitrary.
806 if (WideableCond) 806 if (WideableCond)

891 using namespace PatternMatch; 891 using namespace PatternMatch;

893 BasicBlock *LoopLatch = L->getLoopLatch(); 893 BasicBlock *LoopLatch = L->getLoopLatch();

924 // recurrence. 924 // recurrence.

956 956
957 bool LoopPredication::isLoopProfitableToPredicate() { 957 bool LoopPredication::isLoopProfitableToPredicate() {
958 if (SkipProfitabilityChecks) 958 if (SkipProfitabilityChecks)
959 return true; 959 return true;
960 960
961 SmallVector, 8> ExitEdges; 961 SmallVector, 8> ExitEdges;
962 L->getExitEdges(ExitEdges); 962 L->getExitEdges(ExitEdges);
963 // If there is only one exiting edge in the loop, it is always profitable to 963 // If there is only one exiting edge in the loop, it is always profitable to
964 // predicate the loop. 964 // predicate the loop.
965 if (ExitEdges.size() == 1) 965 if (ExitEdges.size() == 1)
966 return true; 966 return true;
967 967
968 // Calculate the exiting probabilities of all exiting edges from the loop, 968 // Calculate the exiting probabilities of all exiting edges from the loop,
969 // starting with the LatchExitProbability. 969 // starting with the LatchExitProbability.
970 // Heuristic for profitability: If any of the exiting blocks' probability of 970 // Heuristic for profitability: If any of the exiting blocks' probability of
971 // exiting the loop is larger than exiting through the latch block, it's not 971 // exiting the loop is larger than exiting through the latch block, it's not

977 "expected to be an exiting block with 2 succs!"); 977 "expected to be an exiting block with 2 succs!");

979 LatchTerm->getSuccessor(0) == L->getHeader() ? 1 : 0; 979 LatchTerm->getSuccessor(0) == L->getHeader() ? 1 : 0;
980 // We compute branch probabilities without BPI. We do not rely on BPI since 980 // We compute branch probabilities without BPI. We do not rely on BPI since
981 // Loop predication is usually run in an LPM and BPI is only preserved 981 // Loop predication is usually run in an LPM and BPI is only preserved
982 // lossily within loop pass managers, while BPI has an inherent notion of 982 // lossily within loop pass managers, while BPI has an inherent notion of
983 // being complete for an entire function. 983 // being complete for an entire function.
984 984
985 // If the latch exits into a deoptimize or an unreachable block, do not 985 // If the latch exits into a deoptimize or an unreachable block, do not
986 // predicate on that latch check. 986 // predicate on that latch check.
987 auto *LatchExitBlock = LatchTerm->getSuccessor(LatchBrExitIdx); 987 auto *LatchExitBlock = LatchTerm->getSuccessor(LatchBrExitIdx);
988 if (isa(LatchTerm) || 988 if (isa(LatchTerm) ||
989 LatchExitBlock->getTerminatingDeoptimizeCall()) 989 LatchExitBlock->getTerminatingDeoptimizeCall())
990 return false; 990 return false;
991 991
992 // Latch terminator has no valid profile data, so nothing to check 992 // Latch terminator has no valid profile data, so nothing to check
993 // profitability on. 993 // profitability on.
994 if (!hasValidBranchWeightMD(*LatchTerm)) 994 if (!hasValidBranchWeightMD(*LatchTerm))
995 return true; 995 return true;
996 996
997 auto ComputeBranchProbability = 997 auto ComputeBranchProbability =
998 [&](const BasicBlock *ExitingBlock, 998 [&](const BasicBlock *ExitingBlock,
999 const BasicBlock *ExitBlock) -> BranchProbability { 999 const BasicBlock *ExitBlock) -> BranchProbability {
1000 auto *Term = ExitingBlock->getTerminator(); 1000 auto *Term = ExitingBlock->getTerminator();
1001 unsigned NumSucc = Term->getNumSuccessors(); 1001 unsigned NumSucc = Term->getNumSuccessors();
1002 if (MDNode *ProfileData = getValidBranchWeightMDNode(*Term)) { 1002 if (MDNode *ProfileData = getValidBranchWeightMDNode(*Term)) {
1003 SmallVector Weights; 1003 SmallVector Weights;
1004 extractBranchWeights(ProfileData, Weights); 1004 extractBranchWeights(ProfileData, Weights);
1005 uint64_t Numerator = 0, Denominator = 0; 1005 uint64_t Numerator = 0, Denominator = 0;
1006 for (auto [i, Weight] : llvm::enumerate(Weights)) { 1006 for (auto [i, Weight] : llvm::enumerate(Weights)) {
1007 if (Term->getSuccessor(i) == ExitBlock) 1007 if (Term->getSuccessor(i) == ExitBlock)
1008 Numerator += Weight; 1008 Numerator += Weight;
1009 Denominator += Weight; 1009 Denominator += Weight;
1010 } 1010 }
1011 return BranchProbability::getBranchProbability(Numerator, Denominator); 1011 return BranchProbability::getBranchProbability(Numerator, Denominator);
1012 } else { 1012 } else {
1013 assert(LatchBlock != ExitingBlock && 1013 assert(LatchBlock != ExitingBlock &&
1014 "Latch term should always have profile data!"); 1014 "Latch term should always have profile data!");
1015 // No profile data, so we choose the weight as 1/num_of_succ(Src) 1015 // No profile data, so we choose the weight as 1/num_of_succ(Src)
1016 return BranchProbability::getBranchProbability(1, NumSucc); 1016 return BranchProbability::getBranchProbability(1, NumSucc);
1017 } 1017 }
1018 }; 1018 };
1019 1019
1020 BranchProbability LatchExitProbability = 1020 BranchProbability LatchExitProbability =
1021 ComputeBranchProbability(LatchBlock, LatchExitBlock); 1021 ComputeBranchProbability(LatchBlock, LatchExitBlock);

1023 // Protect against degenerate inputs provided by the user. Providing a value 1023 // Protect against degenerate inputs provided by the user. Providing a value
1024 // less than one, can invert the definition of profitable loop predication. 1024 // less than one, can invert the definition of profitable loop predication.
1025 float ScaleFactor = LatchExitProbabilityScale; 1025 float ScaleFactor = LatchExitProbabilityScale;

1033 } 1033 }
1034 const auto LatchProbabilityThreshold = LatchExitProbability * ScaleFactor; 1034 const auto LatchProbabilityThreshold = LatchExitProbability * ScaleFactor;

1084 /// Return the minimum of all analyzeable exit counts. This is an upper bound 1084 /// Return the minimum of all analyzeable exit counts. This is an upper bound

1107 1107
1108 /// This implements an analogous, but entirely distinct transform from the main 1108 /// This implements an analogous, but entirely distinct transform from the main
1109 /// loop predication transform. This one is phrased in terms of using a 1109 /// loop predication transform. This one is phrased in terms of using a
1110 /// widenable branch *outside* the loop to allow us to simplify loop exits in a 1110 /// widenable branch *outside* the loop to allow us to simplify loop exits in a
1111 /// following loop. This is close in spirit to the IndVarSimplify transform 1111 /// following loop. This is close in spirit to the IndVarSimplify transform
1112 /// of the same name, but is materially different widening loosens legality 1112 /// of the same name, but is materially different widening loosens legality
1113 /// sharply. 1113 /// sharply.
1114 bool LoopPredication::predicateLoopExits(Loop *L, SCEVExpander &Rewriter) { 1114 bool LoopPredication::predicateLoopExits(Loop *L, SCEVExpander &Rewriter) {
1115 // The transformation performed here aims to widen a widenable condition 1115 // The transformation performed here aims to widen a widenable condition
1116 // above the loop such that all analyzeable exit leading to deopt are dead. 1116 // above the loop such that all analyzeable exit leading to deopt are dead.

36 // It's tempting to rely on SCEV here, but it has proven to be problematic. --- 36 // It's tempting to rely on SCEV here, but it has proven to be problematic. ---
37 // Generally the facts SCEV provides about the increment step of add --- 37 // Generally the facts SCEV provides about the increment step of add ---
38 // recurrences are true if the backedge of the loop is taken, which implicitly --- 38 // recurrences are true if the backedge of the loop is taken, which implicitly ---
39 // assumes that the guard doesn't fail. Using these facts to optimize the --- 39 // assumes that the guard doesn't fail. Using these facts to optimize the ---
40 // guard results in a circular logic where the guard is optimized under the --- 40 // guard results in a circular logic where the guard is optimized under the ---
41 // assumption that it never fails. --- 41 // assumption that it never fails. ---
42 // --- 42 // ---
43 // For example, in the loop below the induction variable will be marked as nuw --- 43 // For example, in the loop below the induction variable will be marked as nuw ---
44 // basing on the guard. Basing on nuw the guard predicate will be considered --- 44 // basing on the guard. Basing on nuw the guard predicate will be considered ---

46 // variable in the condition with its value on the last iteration. But this --- 46 // variable in the condition with its value on the last iteration. But this ---
47 // transformation is not correct, e.g. e = 4, b = 5 breaks the loop. --- 47 // transformation is not correct, e.g. e = 4, b = 5 breaks the loop. ---
48 // --- 48 // ---

52 // One of the ways to reason about this problem is to use an inductive proof --- 52 // One of the ways to reason about this problem is to use an inductive proof ---
53 // approach. Given the loop: --- 53 // approach. Given the loop: ---
54 // --- 54 // ---
55 // if (B(0)) { --- 55 // if (B(0)) { ---
56 // do { --- 56 // do { ---
57 // I = PHI(0, I.INC) --- 57 // I = PHI(0, I.INC) ---
58 // I.INC = I + Step --- 58 // I.INC = I + Step ---
59 // guard(G(I)); --- 59 // guard(G(I)); ---
60 // } while (B(I)); --- 60 // } while (B(I)); ---
61 // } --- 61 // } ---
62 // --- 62 // ---
63 // where B(x) and G(x) are predicates that map integers to booleans, we want a --- 63 // where B(x) and G(x) are predicates that map integers to booleans, we want a ---
64 // loop invariant expression M such the following program has the same semantics --- 64 // loop invariant expression M such the following program has the same semantics ---
65 // as the above: --- 65 // as the above: ---
66 // --- 66 // ---
67 // if (B(0)) { --- 67 // if (B(0)) { ---
68 // do { --- 68 // do { ---
69 // I = PHI(0, I.INC) --- 69 // I = PHI(0, I.INC) ---
70 // I.INC = I + Step --- 70 // I.INC = I + Step ---
71 // guard(G(0) && M); --- 71 // guard(G(0) && M); ---
72 // } while (B(I)); --- 72 // } while (B(I)); ---
73 // } --- 73 // } ---
74 // --- 74 // ---
75 // One solution for M is M = forall X . (G(X) && B(X)) => G(X + Step) --- 75 // One solution for M is M = forall X . (G(X) && B(X)) => G(X + Step) ---
76 // --- 76 // ---
77 // Informal proof that the transformation above is correct: --- 77 // Informal proof that the transformation above is correct: ---
78 // --- 78 // ---
79 // By the definition of guards we can rewrite the guard condition to: --- 79 // By the definition of guards we can rewrite the guard condition to: ---
80 // G(I) && G(0) && M --- 80 // G(I) && G(0) && M ---
81 // --- 81 // ---
82 // Let's prove that for each iteration of the loop: --- 82 // Let's prove that for each iteration of the loop: ---
83 // G(0) && M => G(I) --- 83 // G(0) && M => G(I) ---
84 // And the condition above can be simplified to G(Start) && M. --- 84 // And the condition above can be simplified to G(Start) && M. ---
85 // --- 85 // ---
86 // Induction base. --- 86 // Induction base. ---
87 // G(0) && M => G(0) --- 87 // G(0) && M => G(0) ---
88 // --- 88 // ---
89 // Induction step. Assuming G(0) && M => G(I) on the subsequent --- 89 // Induction step. Assuming G(0) && M => G(I) on the subsequent ---
90 // iteration: --- 90 // iteration: ---
91 // --- 91 // ---
92 // B(I) is true because it's the backedge condition. --- 92 // B(I) is true because it's the backedge condition. ---
93 // G(I) is true because the backedge is guarded by this condition. --- 93 // G(I) is true because the backedge is guarded by this condition. ---
94 // --- 94 // ---
95 // So M = forall X . (G(X) && B(X)) => G(X + Step) implies G(I + Step). --- 95 // So M = forall X . (G(X) && B(X)) => G(X + Step) implies G(I + Step). ---
96 // --- 96 // ---
97 // Note that we can use anything stronger than M, i.e. any condition which --- 97 // Note that we can use anything stronger than M, i.e. any condition which ---
98 // implies M. --- 98 // implies M. ---
99 // --- 99 // ---
100 // When S = 1 (i.e. forward iterating loop), the transformation is supported --- 100 // When S = 1 (i.e. forward iterating loop), the transformation is supported ---
101 // when: --- 101 // when: ---
102 // * The loop has a single latch with the condition of the form: --- 102 // * The loop has a single latch with the condition of the form: ---
103 // B(X) = latchStart + X latchLimit, --- 103 // B(X) = latchStart + X latchLimit, ---
104 // where is u<, u<=, s<, or s<=. --- 104 // where is u<, u<=, s<, or s<=. ---
105 // * The guard condition is of the form --- 105 // * The guard condition is of the form ---
106 // G(X) = guardStart + X u< guardLimit --- 106 // G(X) = guardStart + X u< guardLimit ---
107 // --- 107 // ---
108 // For the ult latch comparison case M is: --- 108 // For the ult latch comparison case M is: ---
109 // forall X . guardStart + X u< guardLimit && latchStart + X --- 109 // forall X . guardStart + X u< guardLimit && latchStart + X ---
110 // guardStart + X + 1 u< guardLimit --- 110 // guardStart + X + 1 u< guardLimit ---
111 // --- 111 // ---
112 // The only way the antecedent can be true and the consequent can be false is --- 112 // The only way the antecedent can be true and the consequent can be false is ---
113 // if --- 113 // if ---
114 // X == guardLimit - 1 - guardStart --- 114 // X == guardLimit - 1 - guardStart ---
115 // (and guardLimit is non-zero, but we won't use this latter fact). --- 115 // (and guardLimit is non-zero, but we won't use this latter fact). ---
116 // If X == guardLimit - 1 - guardStart then the second half of the antecedent is --- 116 // If X == guardLimit - 1 - guardStart then the second half of the antecedent is ---
117 // latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart u< latchLimit --- 117 // latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart u< latchLimit ---
118 // and its negation is --- 118 // and its negation is ---
119 // latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart u>= latchLimit --- 119 // latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart u>= latchLimit ---
120 // --- 120 // ---
121 // In other words, if --- 121 // In other words, if ---
122 // latchLimit u<= latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart --- 122 // latchLimit u<= latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart ---
123 // then: --- 123 // then: ---
124 // (the ranges below are written in ConstantRange notation, where [A, B) is the --- 124 // (the ranges below are written in ConstantRange notation, where [A, B) is the ---
125 // set for (I = A; I != B; I++ /*maywrap*/) yield(I);) --- 125 // set for (I = A; I != B; I++ /*maywrap*/) yield(I);) ---
126 // --- 126 // ---
127 // forall X . guardStart + X u< guardLimit && --- 127 // forall X . guardStart + X u< guardLimit && ---
128 // latchStart + X u< latchLimit => --- 128 // latchStart + X u< latchLimit => ---
129 // guardStart + X + 1 u< guardLimit --- 129 // guardStart + X + 1 u< guardLimit ---
130 // == forall X . guardStart + X u< guardLimit && --- 130 // == forall X . guardStart + X u< guardLimit && ---
131 // latchStart + X u< latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart => --- 131 // latchStart + X u< latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart => ---
132 // guardStart + X + 1 u< guardLimit --- 132 // guardStart + X + 1 u< guardLimit ---
133 // == forall X . (guardStart + X) in [0, guardLimit) && --- 133 // == forall X . (guardStart + X) in [0, guardLimit) && ---
134 // (latchStart + X) in [0, latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart) => --- 134 // (latchStart + X) in [0, latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart) => ---
135 // (guardStart + X + 1) in [0, guardLimit) --- 135 // (guardStart + X + 1) in [0, guardLimit) ---
136 // == forall X . X in [-guardStart, guardLimit - guardStart) && --- 136 // == forall X . X in [-guardStart, guardLimit - guardStart) && ---
137 // X in [-latchStart, guardLimit - 1 - guardStart) => --- 137 // X in [-latchStart, guardLimit - 1 - guardStart) => ---
138 // X in [-guardStart - 1, guardLimit - guardStart - 1) --- 138 // X in [-guardStart - 1, guardLimit - guardStart - 1) ---
139 // == true --- 139 // == true ---
140 // --- 140 // ---
141 // So the widened condition is: --- 141 // So the widened condition is: ---
142 // guardStart u< guardLimit && --- 142 // guardStart u< guardLimit && ---
143 // latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart u>= latchLimit --- 143 // latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart u>= latchLimit ---
144 // Similarly for ule condition the widened condition is: --- 144 // Similarly for ule condition the widened condition is: ---
145 // guardStart u< guardLimit && --- 145 // guardStart u< guardLimit && ---
146 // latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart u> latchLimit --- 146 // latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart u> latchLimit ---
147 // For slt condition the widened condition is: --- 147 // For slt condition the widened condition is: ---
148 // guardStart u< guardLimit && --- 148 // guardStart u< guardLimit && ---
149 // latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart s>= latchLimit --- 149 // latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart s>= latchLimit ---
150 // For sle condition the widened condition is: --- 150 // For sle condition the widened condition is: ---
151 // guardStart u< guardLimit && --- 151 // guardStart u< guardLimit && ---
152 // latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart s> latchLimit --- 152 // latchStart + guardLimit - 1 - guardStart s> latchLimit ---
153 // --- 153 // ---
154 // When S = -1 (i.e. reverse iterating loop), the transformation is supported --- 154 // When S = -1 (i.e. reverse iterating loop), the transformation is supported ---
155 // when: --- 155 // when: ---
156 // * The loop has a single latch with the condition of the form: --- 156 // * The loop has a single latch with the condition of the form: ---
157 // B(X) = X latchLimit, where is u>, u>=, s>, or s>=. --- 157 // B(X) = X latchLimit, where is u>, u>=, s>, or s>=. ---
158 // * The guard condition is of the form --- 158 // * The guard condition is of the form ---
159 // G(X) = X - 1 u< guardLimit --- 159 // G(X) = X - 1 u< guardLimit ---
160 // --- 160 // ---
161 // For the ugt latch comparison case M is: --- 161 // For the ugt latch comparison case M is: ---
162 // forall X. X-1 u< guardLimit and X u> latchLimit => X-2 u< guardLimit --- 162 // forall X. X-1 u< guardLimit and X u> latchLimit => X-2 u< guardLimit ---
163 // --- 163 // ---
164 // The only way the antecedent can be true and the consequent can be false is if --- 164 // The only way the antecedent can be true and the consequent can be false is if ---
165 // X == 1. --- 165 // X == 1. ---
166 // If X == 1 then the second half of the antecedent is --- 166 // If X == 1 then the second half of the antecedent is ---
167 // 1 u> latchLimit, and its negation is latchLimit u>= 1. --- 167 // 1 u> latchLimit, and its negation is latchLimit u>= 1. ---
168 // --- 168 // ---
169 // So the widened condition is: --- 169 // So the widened condition is: ---
170 // guardStart u< guardLimit && latchLimit u>= 1. --- 170 // guardStart u< guardLimit && latchLimit u>= 1. ---
171 // Similarly for sgt condition the widened condition is: --- 171 // Similarly for sgt condition the widened condition is: ---
172 // guardStart u< guardLimit && latchLimit s>= 1. --- 172 // guardStart u< guardLimit && latchLimit s>= 1. ---
173 // For uge condition the widened condition is: --- 173 // For uge condition the widened condition is: ---
174 // guardStart u< guardLimit && latchLimit u> 1. --- 174 // guardStart u< guardLimit && latchLimit u> 1. ---
175 // For sge condition the widened condition is: --- 175 // For sge condition the widened condition is: ---
176 // guardStart u< guardLimit && latchLimit s> 1. --- 176 // guardStart u< guardLimit && latchLimit s> 1. ---
177 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===// --- 177 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===// ---

388 --- 388 ---
389 std::optional LoopPredication::parseLoopICmp(ICmpInst *ICI) { 0 389 std::optional LoopPredication::parseLoopICmp(ICmpInst *ICI) { 0
390 auto Pred = ICI->getPredicate(); 0 390 auto Pred = ICI->getPredicate(); 0
391 auto *LHS = ICI->getOperand(0); 0 391 auto *LHS = ICI->getOperand(0); 0
392 auto *RHS = ICI->getOperand(1); 0 392 auto *RHS = ICI->getOperand(1); 0
393 --- 393 ---
394 const SCEV *LHSS = SE->getSCEV(LHS); 0 394 const SCEV *LHSS = SE->getSCEV(LHS); 0
395 if (isa(LHSS)) 0 395 if (isa(LHSS)) 0
396 return std::nullopt; 0 396 return std::nullopt; 0
397 const SCEV *RHSS = SE->getSCEV(RHS); 0 397 const SCEV *RHSS = SE->getSCEV(RHS); 0
398 if (isa(RHSS)) 0 398 if (isa(RHSS)) 0
399 return std::nullopt; 0 399 return std::nullopt; 0
400 --- 400 ---
401 // Canonicalize RHS to be loop invariant bound, LHS - a loop computable IV --- 401 // Canonicalize RHS to be loop invariant bound, LHS - a loop computable IV ---
402 if (SE->isLoopInvariant(LHSS, L)) { 0 402 if (SE->isLoopInvariant(LHSS, L)) { 0
403 std::swap(LHS, RHS); 0 403 std::swap(LHS, RHS); 0
404 std::swap(LHSS, RHSS); 0 404 std::swap(LHSS, RHSS); 0
405 Pred = ICmpInst::getSwappedPredicate(Pred); 0 405 Pred = ICmpInst::getSwappedPredicate(Pred); 0
406 } --- 406 } ---
407 --- 407 ---
408 const SCEVAddRecExpr *AR = dyn_cast(LHSS); 0 408 const SCEVAddRecExpr *AR = dyn_cast(LHSS); 0
409 if (!AR || AR->getLoop() != L) 0 409 if (!AR || AR->getLoop() != L) 0
410 return std::nullopt; 0 410 return std::nullopt; 0
411 --- 411 ---
412 return LoopICmp(Pred, AR, RHSS); 0 412 return LoopICmp(Pred, AR, RHSS); 0
413 } --- 413 } ---
414 --- 414 ---
415 Value *LoopPredication::expandCheck(SCEVExpander &Expander, 0 415 Value *LoopPredication::expandCheck(SCEVExpander &Expander, 0
416 Instruction *Guard, --- 416 Instruction *Guard, ---
417 ICmpInst::Predicate Pred, const SCEV *LHS, --- 417 ICmpInst::Predicate Pred, const SCEV *LHS, ---
418 const SCEV *RHS) { --- 418 const SCEV *RHS) { ---
419 Type *Ty = LHS->getType(); 0 419 Type *Ty = LHS->getType(); 0

678 --- 678 ---
679 static void normalizePredicate(ScalarEvolution *SE, Loop *L, 0 679 static void normalizePredicate(ScalarEvolution *SE, Loop *L, 0
680 LoopICmp& RC) { --- 680 LoopICmp& RC) { ---
681 // LFTR canonicalizes checks to the ICMP_NE/EQ form; normalize back to the --- 681 // LFTR canonicalizes checks to the ICMP_NE/EQ form; normalize back to the ---
682 // ULT/UGE form for ease of handling by our caller. --- 682 // ULT/UGE form for ease of handling by our caller. ---
683 if (ICmpInst::isEquality(RC.Pred) && 0 683 if (ICmpInst::isEquality(RC.Pred) && 0
684 RC.IV->getStepRecurrence(*SE)->isOne() && 0 684 RC.IV->getStepRecurrence(*SE)->isOne() && 0
685 SE->isKnownPredicate(ICmpInst::ICMP_ULE, RC.IV->getStart(), RC.Limit)) 0 685 SE->isKnownPredicate(ICmpInst::ICMP_ULE, RC.IV->getStart(), RC.Limit)) 0
686 RC.Pred = RC.Pred == ICmpInst::ICMP_NE ? 0 686 RC.Pred = RC.Pred == ICmpInst::ICMP_NE ? 0

957 bool LoopPredication::isLoopProfitableToPredicate() { 0 957 bool LoopPredication::isLoopProfitableToPredicate() { 0
958 if (SkipProfitabilityChecks) 0 958 if (SkipProfitabilityChecks) 0
959 return true; 0 959 return true; 0
960 --- 960 ---
961 SmallVector, 8> ExitEdges; 0 961 SmallVector, 8> ExitEdges; 0
962 L->getExitEdges(ExitEdges); 0 962 L->getExitEdges(ExitEdges); 0
963 // If there is only one exiting edge in the loop, it is always profitable to --- 963 // If there is only one exiting edge in the loop, it is always profitable to ---
964 // predicate the loop. --- 964 // predicate the loop. ---
965 if (ExitEdges.size() == 1) 0 965 if (ExitEdges.size() == 1) 0
966 return true; 0 966 return true; 0
967 --- 967 ---
968 // Calculate the exiting probabilities of all exiting edges from the loop, --- 968 // Calculate the exiting probabilities of all exiting edges from the loop, ---
969 // starting with the LatchExitProbability. --- 969 // starting with the LatchExitProbability. ---
970 // Heuristic for profitability: If any of the exiting blocks' probability of --- 970 // Heuristic for profitability: If any of the exiting blocks' probability of ---
971 // exiting the loop is larger than exiting through the latch block, it's not --- 971 // exiting the loop is larger than exiting through the latch block, it's not ---
972 // profitable to predicate the loop. --- 972 // profitable to predicate the loop. ---
973 auto *LatchBlock = L->getLoopLatch(); 0 973 auto *LatchBlock = L->getLoopLatch(); 0
974 assert(LatchBlock && "Should have a single latch at this point!"); 0 974 assert(LatchBlock && "Should have a single latch at this point!"); 0
975 auto *LatchTerm = LatchBlock->getTerminator(); 0 975 auto *LatchTerm = LatchBlock->getTerminator(); 0
976 assert(LatchTerm->getNumSuccessors() == 2 && 0 976 assert(LatchTerm->getNumSuccessors() == 2 && 0
977 "expected to be an exiting block with 2 succs!"); --- 977 "expected to be an exiting block with 2 succs!"); ---
978 unsigned LatchBrExitIdx = --- 978 unsigned LatchBrExitIdx = ---
979 LatchTerm->getSuccessor(0) == L->getHeader() ? 1 : 0; 0 979 LatchTerm->getSuccessor(0) == L->getHeader() ? 1 : 0; 0
980 // We compute branch probabilities without BPI. We do not rely on BPI since --- 980 // We compute branch probabilities without BPI. We do not rely on BPI since ---
981 // Loop predication is usually run in an LPM and BPI is only preserved --- 981 // Loop predication is usually run in an LPM and BPI is only preserved ---
982 // lossily within loop pass managers, while BPI has an inherent notion of --- 982 // lossily within loop pass managers, while BPI has an inherent notion of ---
983 // being complete for an entire function. --- 983 // being complete for an entire function. ---
984 --- 984 ---
985 // If the latch exits into a deoptimize or an unreachable block, do not --- 985 // If the latch exits into a deoptimize or an unreachable block, do not ---
986 // predicate on that latch check. --- 986 // predicate on that latch check. ---
987 auto *LatchExitBlock = LatchTerm->getSuccessor(LatchBrExitIdx); 0 987 auto *LatchExitBlock = LatchTerm->getSuccessor(LatchBrExitIdx); 0
988 if (isa(LatchTerm) || 0 988 if (isa(LatchTerm) || 0
989 LatchExitBlock->getTerminatingDeoptimizeCall()) 0 989 LatchExitBlock->getTerminatingDeoptimizeCall()) 0
990 return false; 0 990 return false; 0
991 --- 991 ---
